image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: A report by Tasmania's auditor-general pointing out the financial challenges facing TT-Line show the ferry operator was insolvent in August, despite a $400 million increase in its borrowing capacity.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania operator was 'insolvent,' audit says, but board disagrees

image.altText: A mountain with snow on it

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has made a draft recommendation for a cable car on Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington, documents released under Right to Information laws show.

title.children: Kunanyi/Mount Wellington cable car included in draft recommendations

image.altText: Nathan Broad, Dion Prestia and Tom Lynch walking together

props.synopsis: Richmond will run out for a home game in Tasmania for the first time in its history next season in a decision the club says it has not taken lightly.

title.children: 'Commercial considerations' see Tigers sell home AFL game to Tasmania

image.altText: Dead fish floating in a pen at a barramundi farm.

props.synopsis: Foreign-owned aquaculture company Tassal suffers a fish kill at its barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay, where the company has plans to expand. It follows a mass mortality in Tasmania's salmon industry, which also affected Tassal.

title.children: Tassal eyes barramundi expansion despite parasite leading to fish kill

image.altText: John Whittington in a suit and glasses stands on Battery Point foreshore with a group of workers in caps and hi-vis jackets.

props.synopsis: Salmon Tasmania chief executive John Whittington says the fish farm industry wants to ensure they give "clear, transparent" information on where and when the antibiotic florfenicol is used.

title.children: LISTEN: ðŸ“¢ Salmon Tasmania 'committed' to florfenicol use

image.altText: An aerial view of a village on a lush green hilltop under a blanket of clouds.

props.synopsis: Fusion Australia has owned and run the former Hydro Tasmania town in Tasmania's Northern Midlands for 30 years, but is now divesting its assets there, clearing the way for a new generation of residents.Â

title.children: Christian charity to leave town, sparking new chapter for remote village

image.altText: A vibrant green bird in grass

props.synopsis: The presence of an endangered and "cryptic" parrot species at a northern Tasmanian national park is hailed as "very good news" by a bird expert.

title.children: Endangered parrot found in northern Tasmania for first time in decades

image.altText: A male and female farmer work outside on their veggie farm on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The new regulations would bring Tasmania into line with national standards, but smaller growers are worried they will have to pay the same fees and meet the same auditing requirements as large-scale growers.Â

title.children: Uncertainty for small-scale Tasmanian farmers over new food safety rules

image.altText: White smoke billows after an explosion at KK Park online scam centre in Myawaddy township, Karen State, Myanmar.

props.synopsis:
Myanmar junta bombing of a scam centre is little more than "political theatre" to appease the international community, an expert says.

Â 

Â

title.children: Myanmar bombed a massive scam centre â€” but the industry could be about to hit overdrive

image.altText: two men in suits

props.synopsis: The state's first cross-border commissioner was found dead at his home on Monday morning. Police say his death is not being treated as suspicious.

title.children: Former Queensland police union boss Ian Leavers found dead

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price looking upwards, seriously.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was due to speak at the Put Australia First event later this month alongside Tommy Robinson, a one-time member of a fascist political party.Â

title.children: Nampijinpa Price pulls out of rally with far-right activist Tommy Robinson

image.altText: A kid in a fedora stands next to police officers.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old is unmasked as the "Fedora man" in a viral image taken outside the Louvre on the day of the crown jewels heist.

title.children: French 'Fedora man' pictured at Louvre heist scene unmasked

image.altText: Close up of Andrew Hauser with flags behind him

props.synopsis: The central bank's deputy governor says it's "more plausible" to wonder whether rates can go much further than to forecast further cuts. He says unless Australia's economic capacity lifts, the economy will struggle to grow without generating inflation.

title.children: RBA warns economy in danger of being 'boxed in' to slow growth

image.altText: Maria Garcia with boxes of food collected from a food bank.

props.synopsis: Unpaid federal workers are turning to food banks and draining their savings as the longest US government shutdown in history drags on.

title.children: 'I didn't vote for this': Millions of Americans go hungry as shutdown hits day 40

image.altText: An empty street with a sign above it for Bristol City.

props.synopsis: These two US cities share a name and a main street, but come election time, following the rules on one side of the road could land you in jail on the other.

title.children: This street is home to two cities with opposite laws and politics

image.altText: A group of about sixty people from the NSN dressed in black at a rally outside NSW parliament house in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The federal Member for Wentworth and the NSW Member for Vaucluse posted to social media denouncing the antisemitic rally by Neo-Nazis in Sydney, and offensive messages they received in response have been flagged with police.

title.children: 'Vile abuse' against MPs after Neo-Nazi demonstration referred to police

image.altText: Flames and smoke from the Cudlee Creek fire in the Adelaide Hills.

props.synopsis: Victims of the devastating 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, which caused more than $200 million in damage, are seeking compensation from SA Power Networks, alleging the electricity distributor was negligent in the lead-up to the blaze.

title.children: Class action trial over catastrophic Cudlee Creek bushfire begins in SA

image.altText: Cameron Green in his bowling follow-through.

props.synopsis: Australia is hopeful that a slight adjustment to Cameron Green's bowling action allows the star all-rounder to have a big say in this summer's Ashes campaign and beyond.

title.children: 'Didn't cut any corners': Green to test tweaked action ahead of Ashes

image.altText: A wind vane water pump in the foreground with idle wind power turbines in the background

props.synopsis: Mountains of clean power are regularly "wasted" as Australia's energy system evolves. But a large amount of battery storage is waiting in the wings, ready to soak it up.

title.children: Free power as wind farms grind to a halt. Whatâ€™s happening?

image.altText: A row of brand new electric bikes lined up inside a bike shop

props.synopsis: E-bikes and e-scooters might sound like an exciting gift for a teenager or child, but experts say there are several things to consider before buying one.Â

title.children: If your child wants an e-bike or e-scooter, this is what you need to know

image.altText: A picture of a childs torso covered in a red rash

props.synopsis: Authorities and experts urge people in the state's south to be on alert for measles as the number of community transmission cases continues to climb.

title.children: WA records highest number of measles cases since 1997

image.altText: a plunge pool on a display home.

props.synopsis: A child has died after being found unresponsive in a pool in northern Victoria.Â

title.children: 8yo boy dies after being found unresponsive in display home pool

image.altText: A man smiling in a boxing gym holding a drink and with clenched fist

props.synopsis: A driver has been handed a 16-year jail sentence after he "used his vehicle as a weapon" to cause the tragic death of Rhyce Harding in Sydney's west.

title.children: Driver jailed for 16 years over 'extreme' Sydney road rage death

image.altText: An elderly man in a cream suit walks through a group of clapping people

props.synopsis: The biggest names in Australian radio have paid tribute to John "Golden Tonsils" Laws, who died aged 90.

title.children: 'Radio has lost its king': Hosts pay tribute to John Laws

image.altText: Donald Trump waves

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is booed by sections of the crowd as he becomes the first sitting US president to attend a regular-season NFL game in nearly half a century.

title.children: Trump booed by crowd at NFL game in Washington

image.altText: Andrew Dillon stands in front of an AFL logo while speaking at a press conference

props.synopsis: Footy fans are not impressed with the AFL's new finals-extending Wildcard Round, but it is all part of Andrew Dillon's grand plan for total domination of Australian sport.

title.children: Nobody seems to want an AFL Wildcard Round, so why is it here?

image.altText: A woman and man with grey hair lean against each other, looking sadly down at a photo in their hands of a young woman.

props.synopsis: The family of German backpacker Simone Strobel says a second inquest into her death has failed to bring them answers about how and why she died on holiday in NSW 20 years ago.

title.children: Family tormented by murder say 'most important' witnesses did not give evidence

image.altText: Ballarat Police Station.

props.synopsis: Detectives from the homicide squad have spoken to two adults following the death of a one-year-old boy in regional Victoria.

title.children: Police investigate death of one-year-old boy in Ballarat

image.altText: Brown water floods builds and inundates the surrounding land.

props.synopsis: The massive storm has already killed four people and forced more than a million people to evacuate from flood and landslide-prone areas.

title.children: Super Typhoon Fung-wong makes landfall in the Philippines

image.altText: A photo taken through two concrete pillars of a woman in a cream suit is seen with two women dressed in black.

props.synopsis: The Princess Royal attended a ceremony at the Police Memorial in Melbourne as part of her official visit to Australia.

title.children: Princess Anne lays wreath in honour of Porepunkah police officers

image.altText: Former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol, dressed in a suit, walking with a group.

props.synopsis: Yoon Suk Yeol attempted to provoke military conflict between South and North Korea in order to declare martial law, a prosecutor's spokesperson tells a briefing.

title.children: South Korea's former president accused of provoking military conflict with North Korea

image.altText: Anthony Hansen wears a suit jacket and speaks to reporters from behind a microphone.

props.synopsis: Survivors of the Stolen Generations in Western Australia can now apply for $85,000 in compensation as part of a government redress scheme.

title.children: WA Stolen Generations redress scheme opens to right 'insidious' past

image.altText: Four F1 cars go through a corner, one is turning the wrong way after a collision.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri was involved in the biggest flashpoint of the Formula 1 SÃ£o Paulo Grand Prix, earning him a costly penalty and damaging his chances of winning the drivers' championship.

title.children: Why Piastri was handed a controversial 10-second penalty in Brazil
